title: How to See Unread Outlook Messages on Windows & Mac

steps.title: Log in to Outlook on the Web or open New Outlook.
steps.content: Log in to Outlook on the Web or open New Outlook. If you're using Outlook on the web, log in to your account at https://www.outlook.com . If you use New Outlook on your Windows 10 or 11 PC, open it now. To find out if you're using New Outlook, open the Outlook app for Windows. If you see "Try the new Outlook" and a toggle switch at the top-right corner, you are using the classic version of Outlook and should use the Outlook Classic method instead.

steps.title: Click your Inbox or preferred folder.
steps.content: Click your Inbox or preferred folder. If you want to see unread Outlook messages in your inbox, click Inbox at the upper-right corner. Otherwise, you can select any folder under "Folders."

steps.title: Click the filter icon .
steps.content: Click the filter icon . You will see this above the list of messagesâ€”look for a funnel-shaped icon made of three horizontal lines.

steps.title: Click Unread.
steps.content: Click Unread . This filters your Outlook inbox to show only the messages you haven't read yet. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Open Outlook Classic for Windows.
steps.content: Open Outlook Classic for Windows. If you're using Windows 10 or 11, press the Windows key and type outlook . If you see "Outlook Classic," click to select it. If you don't see this option, just click Outlook . To make sure you're using the correct version for this method, look at the top-right corner of Outlook when it opens. If you see "Try the new Outlook" and a toggle switch at the top-right corner, you are classic Outlook. If not, see the New Outlook method.

steps.title: Click the Unread tab.
steps.content: Click the Unread tab. You'll see it above your inbox. This filters your inbox to display messages you haven't read yet.

steps.title: Open Outlook and click the View menu.
steps.content: Open Outlook and click the View menu. This opens a menu containing several options.

steps.title: Go to Filter By and select Unread.
steps.content: Go to Filter By and select Unread . When you move your cursor to "Filter By," another menu will open. This displays your unread messages in Microsoft Outlook. Alternatively, press Shift + Cmd + O to use a keyboard shortcut to see your unread mail.

steps.title: Open Outlook 2016.
steps.content: Open Outlook 2016. If you have Outlook 2016 installed, open it now. This takes you to your inbox. To find out if you have Outlook 2016, press the Windows key on your keyboard and type outlook . If you see "Outlook 2016", use this method.

steps.title: Click the All drop-down menu.
steps.content: Click the All drop-down menu. It's above your list of messages. A menu will expand.

steps.title: Click Unread Mail on the menu.
steps.content: Click Unread Mail on the menu. This filters the messages in your inbox to show only those which are unread.

steps.title: Open Outlook 2013.
steps.content: Open Outlook 2013. If you have Outlook 2013 installed, open it now. This takes you to your inbox. To find out if you have Outlook 2013, press the Windows key on your keyboard and type outlook . If you see "Outlook 2013," use this method.

steps.title: Click the Filter E-Mail menu.
steps.content: Click the Filter E-Mail menu. This menu is in the "Find" group on the ribbon at the top of Outlook. A menu will expand.

steps.title: Click Unread on the menu.
steps.content: Click Unread on the menu. This filters the messages in your inbox to show only those which are unread.
